long_term_memory:
Storage:
- Local dev DB: PostgreSQL (default localhost).
- Staging DB: PostgreSQL (Docker) with data at /opt/connsura/postgres.
- Uploads stored on disk: /opt/connsura/uploads (server) and connsura-backend/uploads (local).
- Forms served from connsura-backend/forms.

Models:
- User with role (CUSTOMER/AGENT) and 1:1 Agent/Customer.
- User includes emailVerified boolean for verification gating.
- User includes totpEnabled, encrypted totpSecret, totpRecoveryId, totpBackupCodes, totpBackupCodesUpdatedAt for authenticator recovery.
- Agent fields include languages, states, products, appointedCarriers, reviews (JSON strings).
- Customer fields include preferredLangs, priorInsurance, coverages, profileData (JSON strings), plus profileData.forms for CreateProfile data.
- ProfileShare tracks share tokens, code hashes, sections/snapshot, editable status, pending edits, optional recipient name, last access time.
- Driver and Vehicle rows belong to Customer.
- Message links Agent and Customer.
- AdminUser and AuditLog for admin operations.

Data flows:
- Customer profile updates replace drivers/vehicles.
- CreateProfile auto-saves forms into customer.profileData.forms.
- Profile sharing requires emailVerified true; public links require a 4-digit code and optional recipient name.
- Auth recovery uses TOTP secrets and backup codes; recovery ID verifies account before password reset.
- Editable shares store pending edits and apply to profileData.forms after client approval.
- Agent status/approval controlled by admin/onboarding flows.

Open questions:
- Data retention and backup policy not documented.
- Production DB strategy not documented.

Next steps:
- Update memory after deploy or major data model changes.
